snippet: Terry Collins said letting Johan Santana continue past his pitch count Friday “went against just about everything I stand for,” but that he just couldn’t bring himself to pull him from a no-hit bid.
abstract: New York Mets manager Terry Collins says letting Johan Santana continue past his pitch count went against his principles, but that he just could not bring himself to pull Santana from a no-hit bid.
lead_paragraph: Terry Collins said letting Johan Santana continue past his pitch count Friday “went against just about everything I stand for,” but that he just couldn’t bring himself to pull him from a no-hit bid.

headline.seo: For Mets’ Collins, Agonizing Went On After No-Hitter’s Final Out
headline.main: Mets Manager’s Agonizing Did Not End With Santana’s Final Out
